title: ANZ says beware of fintech’s wolves
text:
ANZ chief executive Shayne Elliott said fintech lenders who charge elevated interest rates have serious questions to answer, arguing a bank would be "caned" for putting out the same product.

ANZ CEO Shayne Elliott "We would get caned." Alex Ellinghausen

Mr Elliott was burnishing the bank’s tech credentials when he threw the curve ball to the audience of the Intersekt Festival in Melbourne, where the founders of SME lender Prospa and buy-now-pay-later juggernaut Afterpay Touch have appeared.

The bank boss was elaborating on risk-based pricing for bank customers as a means of shoring up bank earnings when he started in on the short-term lending space.

“So we are starting to see a lot of growth in the payday lending space, which is high risk, I mean it meets a need but there are ethical questions about some of that,” Mr Elliott said.

“There are businesses charging 35 and 40 per cent interest and if we came out with a product like that we would get caned.”
description: ANZ chief executive Shayne Elliott said fintech lenders who charge elevated interest rates have serious questions to answer, arguing a bank would be condemned for putting out the same product.
